intro: Schefflera stilpnophylla, commonly known as the New Caledonia umbrella plant, is a rare and unique species native to the island of New Caledonia. It is characterized by its distinctive, umbrella-like arrangement of leaves, which gives it a striking appearance. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to several meters. Its leaves are thick and leathery, with a glossy surface and a deep green color. Schefflera stilpnophylla is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of its native habitat and is often found in forested areas with high rainfall.
